titles: The lamentable tragedie of Locrine, the eldest sonne of King Brutus discoursing the warres of the Britaines, and Hunnes, with their discomfiture: the Britaines victorie with their accidents, and the death of Albanact. No lesse pleasant then profitable. Newly set foorth, ouerseene and corrected, by VV.S.
author: W. S., fl. 1595.
Peele, George, 1556-1596, attributed name.
Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592, attributed name.
Marlowe, Christopher, 1564-1593, attributed name.
notes: Sometimes attributed to George Peele, to Robert Greene, and to Christopher Marlowe; misattributed to William Shakespeare.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
